newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers weaker amid fewer enquiries.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers weaker amid fewer enquiries.

text.p: The Singapore bunker levels were weak on Friday amid dropping enquiries and traders said the market was likely to remain sluggish due to poor demand.

Some suppliers, trying to get a slice of business said they were quoting the 380-cst level at as low as $95/$96 per tonne. Others were reluctant to move below $98, "I can't do anything below $98 because that means losses," said one supplier.
The 380-cst grade was quoted at $96/$98 per tonne and the 180-cst was at $102/$105. MDO and gas oil stabilised at $190/$193 and $200/$205 respectively.
